alert.note: Alert for Bourbon; Cherokee; Crawford (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 05 at 4:30AM CDT until May 07 at 10:18AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Kansas, including the following areas, Bourbon, Cherokee and Crawford. Portions of Missouri, including the following areas, Barry, Barton, Benton, Camden, Cedar, Christian, Dade, Dallas, Douglas, Greene, Hickory, Jasper, Laclede, Lawrence, McDonald, Newton, Ozark, Polk, St. Clair, Stone, Taney, Vernon, Webster and Wright. * WHEN...Until 1 PM CDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Widespread flooding is ongoing across the area. Any additional heavy rainfall will lead to increased flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Widespread heavy rain fell across the area Wednesday into this morning. Additional rainfall is expected through the morning hours, leading to additional flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
